intro: Strobilanthes rugosa, commonly known as the "Christmas flower," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble a crown of flowers, typically blooming during the rainy season. The plant is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Strobilanthes rugosa is not only ornamental but also holds cultural significance in some regions.
